rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;ce1ed4a8.1503">   <title>FW: Call for papers - Queer 'safe spaces' [3 European Geographies of Sexualities] </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;ce1ed4a8.1503</link>   <description> Forwarded on behalf of Gilly Hartal.<br><br>Dear all (apologies for cross-posting), Please feel free to circulate<br><br>Queer 'Safe Spaces' - Call for Papers<br>Co-organizers: Gilly Hartal, Bar-Ilan University, Lital Pascar, Northwestern University, Yossi David, The Hebrew University<br>III Geographies of Sexualities Conference<br>Crossing Boundaries: Sexualities, Media and (Urban) Spaces. Rome, 16-18 September 2015<br><br>‘Safe space’ is usually understood as a deconstruction of hegemonic discourses, as well as a relational production of alternative spaces constitutive of known logic and rules (Evans & Boyte 1992; Gamson 1996; Polletta 1999; The Roestone Collective 2014). Safety has long been a formative subject within queer [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T19:45:24+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Monk, Janice J - (jmonk)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;ce1ed4a8.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;3cc16b6e.1503">   <title>FW: EUGEO-request </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;3cc16b6e.1503</link>   <description> Call for Papers - EUGEO Conference, Budapest 30th August - 2nd September 2015<br><br>Session P43: &quot;Social difference and the transformation of peripheralities in times of crisis&quot;<br><br>Organisers:<br><br>Kathrin H\ufffd\ufffdrschelmann, Judith Miggelbrink and Judit Tim\ufffd\ufffdr<br><br>Session Outline:<br><br>The geographical consequences of economic crisis cannot be understood in isolation from the socio-spatial practices though which space is co-produced as well as transformed in contexts of everyday life. Spatial practices in these contexts are conducted at the intersection of production and social reproduction. They range from the development of socio-economic coping strategies to the ‘domestication’, transgression and contestation of peripherality, for instance through [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T15:37:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Monk, Janice J - (jmonk)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;3cc16b6e.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;c48a5d3c.1503">   <title>FW: Gender in Global Value Chain and Global Production Network research </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;c48a5d3c.1503</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;c48a5d3c.1503">FW: Gender in Global Value Chain and Global Production Network research </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-03-06T13:02:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Monk, Janice J - (jmonk)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;c48a5d3c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;6e35c397.1503">   <title>FW: Doreen Massey Annual Event: Digital Geographies, 24 March 2015, PROGRAMME and REGISTRATION </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;6e35c397.1503</link>   <description> Please do join us online even if you can't attend in person.<br>Also, we are looking for institutions who might want to use one or more of these sessions as part of their taught programmes and would get students to interact online with the speakers.<br>Please do get in touch if you are able to do so...<br>Best wishes<br>Parvati [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T18:42:11+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Parvati.Raghuram</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;6e35c397.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;13c89aa3.1503">   <title>CFP PG Conference on Myth(s) in the Social Sciences in Humanities - deadline extension </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;13c89aa3.1503</link>   <description> Dear all (apologies for cross posting),<br><br>Deadline extension<br>We have decided to extend the Call for Papers deadline to Monday 9th March, 5pm. For those who have missed the deadline yesterday, abstracts should be no longer than 250 words and must be sent by e-mail to myth-2015@york.ac.uk.<br><br>We invite papers and panels including, but not limited to the following topics: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T12:48:00+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Anais Duong-Pedica</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;13c89aa3.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;2b542564.1503">   <title>Fwd: 2nd CFP: ICDG, 29-30 June, Rochester, NY </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;2b542564.1503</link>   <description> Sent from my iPad<br><br>Begin forwarded message:<br><br>From: Mary Beth Kitzel &lt;mary.kitzel@GMAIL.COM&lt;mailto:mary.kitzel@GMAIL.COM&gt;&gt;<br>Date: March 2, 2015 at 6:46:50 PM MST<br>To: &lt;CRIT-GEOG-FORUM@JISCMAIL.AC.UK&lt;mailto:CRIT-GEOG-FORUM@JISCMAIL.AC.UK&gt;&gt;<br>Subject: 2nd CFP: ICDG, 29-30 June, Rochester, NY<br>Reply-To: Mary Beth Kitzel &lt;mary.kitzel@GMAIL.COM&lt;mailto:mary.kitzel@GMAIL.COM&gt;&gt;<br><br>Dear CRITters,<br><br>With apologies for cross posting.<br>**PLEASE SHARE WIDELY*<br><br>2nd CALL FOR PAPERS<br>The International Conference in Deaf Geographies<br>29-30 June 2014<br>Field School in Deaf Geographies<br>Rochester Institute of Technology<br>Rochester, New York [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T02:37:55+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Monk, Janice J - (jmonk)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;2b542564.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;b58463a0.1503">   <title>books that made me a feminist </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;b58463a0.1503</link>   <description> Dear Feminist Geographers<br><br>I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve just added a new post to my blog bookscombined.com&lt;http://bookscombined.com&gt; that I think you would be interested to know about. The post is called Books that made me a feminist, and is by Linda Mizejewski, a professor of gender studies at The Ohio State University.<br><br>Linda paints a vivid picture of the turbulent gender politics of the 1970s, and talks passionately about the books that forged her feminist identity. Linda\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds not a geographer, and the books she talks about are classics of the feminist canon, rather than being related explicitly to geography, but it\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds still a stimulating [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T15:09:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Emma Longstaff</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;b58463a0.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;46bddd81.1503">   <title>Committee Vacancies - Gender and Feminist Geographies Research Group </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;46bddd81.1503</link>   <description> The Gender and Feminist Geographies Research Group (GFGRG) of the RGS-IBG is looking for a new treasurer and a new web-coordinator. These roles involve:<br><br>Treasurer<br>The treasurer manages GFGRG\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds finances and prepares an annual financial report to the RGS-IBG every January and an interim report for our AGM in August. There is also an expectation that the treasurer will attend committee meetings (3-4 a year) either in person in London or via Skype and play a full role in supporting any activities/events that the committee organises. Due to RGS-IBG rules the treasurer must be a member of the RGS-IBG. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T08:57:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nichola Wood</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;46bddd81.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;ea5ebb40.1502">   <title>The 'Work Economies' theme at the Global Conference on Economic Geography - and session on labour intermediation </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;ea5ebb40.1502</link>   <description> With the usual apologies for cross-postings...<br><br>We are now accepting papers for the 'Work Economies' theme of the Global<br>Conference on Economic Geography, which is being held in Oxford in August<br>(19th-23rd). The theme CFP can be found here:<br><br>http://www.gceg2015.org/call-for-papers.html<br><br>In addition, Janelle Knox-Hayes (convener of the Environmental Economies<br>theme) and I would particularly welcome papers on work, labour and<br>socio-environmental change; or, work and Anthropocene thinking. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T15:23:01-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kendra Strauss</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;ea5ebb40.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;a357bcc0.1502">   <title>Join Us: 2015 Interdisciplinary Sex/Gender conference at UCLA (October 23-24, 2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;a357bcc0.1502</link>   <description> A Critical Moment: Sex/Gender Research at the Intersection of Culture,<br>Brain, &amp; Behavior<br>WHEN: October 23-24, 2015 - Save the Date<br>WHERE: UCLA, Los Angeles, California<br><br>WEBSITES<br>http://www.thefpr.org/conference2015/<br>http://www.thefprconference2015.org &lt;http://www.thefprconference2015.org/&gt;<br><br>Be there when many of the world\ufffd\ufffds leading scholars from the Humanities and<br>Sciences discuss and debate issues at the intersection of sex/gender,<br>culture, brain, and behavior.<br>Great minds. Thrilling discussions. New connections. It\ufffd\ufffds all happening this<br>October 23-24, 2015 at UCLA. Join Us. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T11:28:59-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mamie Wong</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;a357bcc0.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;95febe85.1502">   <title>Registration, travel bursaries, CfP: Myth(s) in the Social Sciences and Humanities </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;95febe85.1502</link>   <description> Hi (apologies for cross-posting),<br><br>Registrations for the PG Conference on 'Myth(s) in the Social Sciences and Humanities' at the University of York are now open. Discounted prices are offered to all undergraduates as well as White Rose DTC postgraduates: http://www.york.ac.uk/sociology/about/news-and-events/department/2015/pg-myths-conference/#tab-5<br><br>We are also still welcoming abstracts until March 2nd (see below for Call for Papers). There will be six travel bursaries available at \ufffd\ufffd50/person. If you would like to be considered for a travel bursary, please send an extra paragraph (150 words maximum) with your abstract explaining why you need the funding. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T11:30:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Anais Duong-Pedica</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;95febe85.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;5b8bf9d0.1502">   <title>FW: Take Action by March 5 to end the global gender technology gap </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;5b8bf9d0.1502</link>   <description> -------- Forwarded Message --------<br>Subject: Take Action by March 5 to end the global gender technology gap<br>Date: Wed, 18 Feb 2015 23:00:39 +0000<br>From: WISAT &lt;info@wisat.org&gt;&lt;mailto:info@wisat.org&gt;<br>Reply-To: WISAT &lt;info@wisat.org&gt;&lt;mailto:info@wisat.org&gt;<br>To: &lt;jdmomsen@ucdavis.edu&gt;&lt;mailto:jdmomsen@ucdavis.edu&gt;<br><br>View this email in your browser&lt;http://us6.campaign-archive1.com/?u=76d7671c01&amp;id=0d6b24bb9a&amp;e=28ece828ec&gt;<br><br>[https://gallery.mailchimp.com/76d7671c01/images/wisat_logo_637_reverse.png]<br><br>Dear Partners,<br><br>We are in the final weeks of the IGNITE petition push to call on governments and the UN system to ensure that girls and women are at the center of scientific and technological revolutions. We want an impressive number of signatures to hand over to key global leaders and need you help in getting the word out. Please send [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T19:51:47+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Monk, Janice J - (jmonk)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;5b8bf9d0.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;71765215.1502">   <title>FW: Chair in Gender Studies / Equality Issues - Universit\ufffd\ufffd Sorbonne Paris Cit\ufffd\ufffd</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;71765215.1502</link>   <description> Call for candidates<br><br>Chair in Gender Studies / Equality Issues<br><br>Universit\ufffd\ufffd Sorbonne Paris Cit\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>The Universit\ufffd\ufffd Sorbonne Paris Cit\ufffd\ufffd (USPC) is launching a call for candidates for a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdgender\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd chair in one of USPC’s eight constituent institutions: Universit\ufffd\ufffd Sorbonne Nouvelle - Paris 3, Universit\ufffd\ufffd Paris Descartes, Universit\ufffd\ufffd Paris Diderot, Universit\ufffd\ufffd Paris 13, \ufffd\ufffdcole des hautes \ufffd\ufffdtudes en sant\ufffd\ufffd publique (EHESP), Institut national des langues et civilisations orientales (INALCO), Institut de physique du globe de Paris (IPGP) and Sciences Po. <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;9021491b.1502</link>   <description> Dear Hilary,<br><br>many thanks for raising this issue for discussion here.<br><br>A few initial thoughts to add:<br><br>Numbers and proportions do matter, but you're right that they are not sufficient in and of themselves.<br><br>The WGSG/GFGRG survey of gender and career experience In UK Geography showed that:<br><br>i) although the gender gap is narrowing for promoted posts, there is still a significant way to go<br>ii) the ethos and culture of any department is really important in shaping attitudes and practices (e.g. the reported differences between a legal right to maternity leave and colleagues' attitudes towards those who took that [...]    </description> </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;67ba3999.1502</link>   <description> Dear all-<br><br>I am pleased to announce an upcoming ESRC seminar series that will run through 2015 and 2016 focusing on building bridges between academics interested in interdisciplinary social science research on breastfeeding on the one hand, and practitioners and policymakers on the other.<br><br>The series consists of six day-long seminars over the next two years in Bristol and Cardiff. A flyer for the first event (March 11th) is attached, however please click on the website below for the full programme. Affecting transitions: intergenerationality, place and emotions </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;b63d17d7.1501</link>   <description> CFP Emotional Geographies Conference<br>University of Edinburgh<br>10-12th June 2015<br><br>Affecting transitions: intergenerationality, place and emotions<br><br>Dr Lisa Procter, University of Sheffield<br>Dr Elizabeth Gagen, Aberystwyth University<br><br>These sessions seek to examine the intersections between intergenerational relationships, place and emotion during children and young people's transitions. So, if you are interested in the 'rural' and 'crime fiction', 'popular culture', this should be an interesting and enjoyable event. We'll also be having a film showing and an authors evening in a local book store! Doing Gender and Justice: freedoms, action and participation </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;3817f023.1501</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Call for papers for the RGS-IBG Annual Conference, Exeter, 2-4 September 2015<br><br>Sponsored by the Geographies of Justice Research Group (GJRG)<br><br>Doing gender and justice: freedoms, action and participation<br>Session convenors: Sally Lloyd-Evans (University of Reading) and Rachel Pain (Durham University)<br>The aim of this session is to explore the different ways in which feminist researchers have engaged with issues attaining to justice, rights and freedoms in different geographical spaces over recent decades. We invite contributions that explore the tensions, challenges and opportunities of researching the everyday lived experiences of individuals and communities seeking to re-make or re-create [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-21T09:09:04+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>PAIN R.H.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;3817f023.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;a7c4a8ce.1501">   <title>FW: 2015 AAG Sexuality and Space Specialty Group Student Paper Competition </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;a7c4a8ce.1501</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;a7c4a8ce.1501">FW: 2015 AAG Sexuality and Space Specialty Group Student Paper Competition </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-01-20T20:13:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Monk, Janice J - (jmonk)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;a7c4a8ce.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;4102cc66.1501">   <title>REVISED DEADLINE - CFP Pre-AAG IGU Gender Commission Conference - Urban Intersectionalities </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;4102cc66.1501</link>   <description> ***With apologies for cross postings***<br><br>Please note the deadline for this call has been brought forward to Friday 23rd January, apologies for any inconvenience.<br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS<br>Pre-AAG IGU Gender Commission Conference: Gendered Rights to the City<br>University of Wisonsin, Milwaulkee<br>April 19th-20th 2015<br><br>'Urban Intersectionalities'<br>Session conveners: Kate Botterill and Peter Hopkins (Newcastle University, UK)<br>Debates about intersectionality have been a key concern for feminist geographers for nearly three decades (e.g. Bastia, 2014; Kobayashi and Peake 1994, Rodo-de-Zarate, 2014, Valentine, 2007). With origins in critical race theory, intersectional frameworks have sought to challenge essentialist and oppressive categorizations of race, [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-20T11:14:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katherine Botterill</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;4102cc66.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;8b9d19aa.1501">   <title>CALL FOR PAPERS - Myth(s) in the Social Sciences and Humanities </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;8b9d19aa.1501</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting!<br><br>Myth(s) in the Social Sciences and Humanities (University of York) - Call for Papers - deadline 2nd March 2015<br>http://www.york.ac.uk/sociology/about/news-and-events/department/2015/pg-myths-conference/<br><br>This postgraduate conference aims to explore the variety and richness of the notion of myth. It seeks to create a space where a multitude of disciplines, perspectives, and methods could be discussed critically. The ambivalence and the ambiguity of 'myth' is intentional. Myth is wide and varied - it can be a problematic social construction; it can be the process of creating meaning; it can even be the myth of meaning itself. Thus this conference plans to [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-19T17:24:54+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Anais Duong-Pedica</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;8b9d19aa.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;1adfaea8.1501">   <title>FPR-UCLA Interdisciplinary Conference on Sex/Gender (October 23-24, 2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;1adfaea8.1501</link>   <description> 6th FPR-UCLA Interdisciplinary Conference<br>A Critical Moment: Sex/Gender Research at the Intersection of Culture,<br>Brain, &amp; Behavior<br>October 23-24, 2015<br>UCLA, Los Angeles, California<br><br>WEBSITES:<br>http://www.thefpr.org/conference2015/<br>http://www.thefprconference2015.org &lt;http://www.thefprconference2015.org/&gt;<br><br>This conference occurs at a critical juncture in sex/gender research in<br>neuroscience, anthropology, psychology, and related disciplines. New<br>theories are utilizing a conception of the brain as dynamic, plastic, and<br>adaptable, and of sex/gender brain and behavioral differences as subject to<br>the influence of a broad range of biological, cultural, and social or<br>environmental factors. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-16T11:48:55-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mamie Wong</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;1adfaea8.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;97085097.1501">   <title>CFP Pre-AAG IGU Gender Commission Conference - Urban Intersectionalities </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;97085097.1501</link>   <description> ***with apologies for cross-posting***<br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS<br><br>Pre-AAG IGU Gender Commission Conference: Gendered Rights to the City<br>University of Wisonsin, Milwaulkee<br>April 19th-20th 2015<br><br>'Urban Intersectionalities'<br><br>Session conveners: Kate Botterill and Peter Hopkins (Newcastle University, UK)<br><br>Debates about intersectionality have been a key concern for feminist geographers for nearly three decades (e.g. Bastia, 2014; Kobayashi and Peake 1994, Rodo-de-Zarate, 2014, Valentine, 2007). With origins in critical race theory, intersectional frameworks have sought to challenge essentialist and oppressive categorizations of race, class and gender, and explore the interdependencies of these categories in understanding marginalization and disadvantage (Crenshaw, 1989). Latterly, a critical [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-16T09:35:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Katherine Botterill</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;97085097.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;a7a64612.1501">   <title>CFP Emotional Geographies Conference - Affecting transitions: intergenerationality, place and emotions </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;a7a64612.1501</link>   <description> CFP Emotional Geographies Conference<br>University of Edinburgh<br>10-12th June 2015<br><br>Affecting transitions: intergenerationality, place and emotions<br><br>Dr Lisa Procter, University of Sheffield<br>Dr Elizabeth Gagen, Aberystwyth University<br><br>These sessions seek to examine the intersections between intergenerational relationships, place and emotion during children and young people's transitions. The sessions respond to growing attention to the effects of transitions into, through, and out of, education across the social sciences (Ecclestone, Biesta and Hughes, 2009). An increasingly significant feature of policy is an assumption that transitions are likely to produce psycho-emotional vulnerability and therefore represent a threat to young people's wellbeing and development [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-15T23:12:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Elizabeth Gagen [elg26]</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;a7a64612.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;58f770bf.1501">   <title>FW: CFP-special issue on Human Geography related to Cuba </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;58f770bf.1501</link>   <description> Please send responses to Cindy Pope at Central Connecticut State University (popec@mail.ccsu.edu)    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-15T22:48:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Monk, Janice J - CALL FOR PAPERS </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;6cc64ad1.1501</link>   <description> Sent from my iPad<br><br>Begin forwarded message:<br><br>From: Maria Abranches &lt;abranches.maria@GMAIL.COM&lt;mailto:abranches.maria@GMAIL.COM&gt;&gt;<br>Date: January 11, 2015 at 2:53:37 AM MST<br>To: &lt;CRIT-GEOG-FORUM@JISCMAIL.AC.UK&lt;mailto:CRIT-GEOG-FORUM@JISCMAIL.AC.UK&gt;&gt;<br>Subject: GENDER RELATIONS AND RISING INEQUALITY - CALL FOR PAPERS<br>Reply-To: Maria Abranches &lt;abranches.maria@GMAIL.COM&lt;mailto:abranches.maria@GMAIL.COM&gt;&gt;<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>The increasing evidence for rising inequalities across developing and developed countries has left us with a deepening concern about where this leaves gender relations, with new questions about directions of change and the new forms that gender inequalities may take in the years to come, and the challenges this will pose for development and social justice. It feels like an important moment for [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-11T13:37:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Monk, Janice J - (jmonk)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;6cc64ad1.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;6a4f1137.1501">   <title>FW: visiting international scholar (Fall 2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;6a4f1137.1501</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;6a4f1137.1501">FW: visiting international scholar (Fall 2015) </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-01-09T16:14:45+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Monk, Janice J - (jmonk)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;6a4f1137.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;c4bc640e.1501">   <title>Call for Papers, AAG Gender Pre-conference: Geography & post-graduate studies in the neoliberal university </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;c4bc640e.1501</link>   <description> ***Apologies for cross-posting<br>IGU Gender Commission AAG pre-conference<br>19-20 April, 2015<br>University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee<br><br>Call for papers<br>Geography &amp; post-graduate studies in the neoliberal university<br>Organizers: Yui Hashimoto (University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee) &amp; Johanna Jokinen (Uppsala University)<br>We are looking for one or two more abstracts to round out a paper session on graduate student and recent graduates' experiences of the neoliberal university.<br>The goal of this paper session is to break down the isolation and to share the joys of grad school while working through some of its most pressing challenges. As a part of a series of sessions regarding [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-08T16:31:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Johanna Jokinen</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;c4bc640e.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;d469590e.1501">   <title>Final call - Gender, Place and Culture: A Journal of Feminist Geography Annual Award for New and Emerging Scholars, 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;d469590e.1501</link>   <description> Gender, Place and Culture: A Journal of Feminist Geography Annual Award for New and Emerging Scholars, 2015<br><br>Application closing date: 16 January 2015<br><br>The editorial team of Gender, Place and Culture is pleased to announce an annual award valued at a maximum of US$1,500 for new and emerging scholars. The award is targeted at emerging researchers who are trying to establish research careers and create research momentum. The purpose is to support the research programme of promising feminist geographers and to give an impetus to their careers. The applicant should be involved in independent research and not be merely part [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-08T14:10:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Hopkins</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;d469590e.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;3055a02a.1501">   <title>FW: [GPOW] : CFP: Geography & post-graduate studies in the neoliberal university, AAG pre-conference IGU Gender 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;3055a02a.1501</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GFGRG;3055a02a.1501">FW: [GPOW] : CFP: Geography & post-graduate studies in the neoliberal university, AAG pre-conference IGU Gender 2015 </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-01-06T23:31:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Monk, Janice J -
